TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DesignerCommandSet extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a base class for design-time tools, not derived from , that provide smart tag or designer verb capabilities.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner> class provides the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.ActionLists%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> properties to query for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb> collections, respectively. However, if a design-time tool author decides not to derive from this class, the DesignerCommandSet class represents an alternative base class to provide this functionality.
The DesignerCommandSet class contains only three members, described in the following table.
|Public member|Description| |-------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A>|Returns the collection of either the smart tags or designer verbs associated with the designed component. The base implementation returns `null`.| |<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.ActionLists%2A>|Gets the collection of all the smart tags associated with the designed component. The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A>.| |<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.Verbs%2A>|Gets the collection of all the designer verbs associated with the designed component. The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A>.|
A DesignerCommandSet should be added as a site-specific service. Externally, a service of this type should first be queried to discover smart tag and designer verb functionality. If this service is not found, then the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner.Verbs%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property should be used instead. This procedure provides a path for backwards compatibility.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because this base class contains no state, the default constructor does nothing.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of all the smart tags associated with the designed component.
Docs.value: A that contains the smart tags for the associated designed component.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A> with the string parameter "ActionLists".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.ICollection GetCommands(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of collection to return, indicating either a or a .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of command objects.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains the specified type—either or —of command objects. The base implementation always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the base implementation always returns `null`, the overridden version supplied by the programmer should return a collection of command objects of the type described by `name`. The base implementation of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.Verbs%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.ActionLists%2A> properties specify the following values and meanings for this parameter.
|String|Meaning| |------------|-------------| |"ActionLists"|Return a collection of all the smart tags associated with the component.| |"Verbs"|Return a collection of all the designer verbs associated with the component.|

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of all the designer verbs associated with the designed component.
Docs.value: A that contains the designer verbs for the associated designed component.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A> with the string parameter "Verbs".
